{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3633439,"name":"Mert Ata BABER","username":"BABER","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/baber/{size}/173331_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-22T18:30:43.910Z","cooked":"

Hi CD,
This bolt under three of our MK4i modules comes loose within minutes of driving. It is scratching against the wheels, creating marks on them and causing the gear above it to move up and down. Only on one of our module the bolt has it stayed in place without coming loose after several months.

20250521_2219271920×3413 271 KB

Loctite is the answer you are seeking

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2025-05-22T18:32:45.954Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":466,"readers_count":465,"score":278.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":502243,"topic_slug":"mk4i-problem","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":12}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":10484,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/mk4i-problem/502243/2","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":10},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":12,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3633459,"name":"Mert Ata BABER","username":"BABER","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/baber/{size}/173331_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-22T18:41:48.962Z","cooked":"

SDS video said to use medium strength thread locker. Each time time we wipe off the old one and reapply thread locker. Should we try with high strength thread locker?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2025-05-22T18:41:48.962Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":452,"readers_count":451,"score":105.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":502243,"topic_slug":"mk4i-problem","display_username":"Mert Ata BABER","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":10484,"username":"cmwilson13","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cmwilson13/{size}/3628_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52778,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/mk4i-problem/502243/3","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3633466,"name":"51 Drive Coach","username":"Josh_Murphy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/josh_murphy/{size}/196759_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-22T18:44:46.843Z","cooked":"

We use loctite 243 blue and have no issues with any modules we’ve used over the last 5 years.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2025-05-22T18:44:46.843Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":441,"readers_count":440,"score":183.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":502243,"topic_slug":"mk4i-problem","display_username":"51 Drive Coach","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":52778,"username":"BABER","name":"Mert Ata BABER","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/baber/{size}/173331_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4422,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/mk4i-problem/502243/4","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5},{"id":"open_mouth","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3633471,"name":"Ken Pontbriant","username":"electroken","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/electroken/{size}/160387_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-22T18:45:54.007Z","cooked":"

None of the hardware in our Mk4i modules has loosened. Loctite 243 is on all of them. It does take some time to cure, usually a few hours depending on the two metals in contact with the material.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2025-05-22T18:45:54.007Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":420,"readers_count":419,"score":104.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":502243,"topic_slug":"mk4i-problem","display_username":"Ken Pontbriant","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":17612,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 230 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/mk4i-problem/502243/5","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3633476,"name":"","username":"cmwilson13","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cmwilson13/{size}/3628_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-22T18:46:21.897Z","cooked":"

Make sure your using 243 not 242 (243 is tolerant of oil 242 is not) and use primer if you still have issues

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2025-05-22T18:46:21.897Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":399,"readers_count":398,"score":84.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":502243,"topic_slug":"mk4i-problem","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":52778,"username":"BABER","name":"Mert Ata BABER","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/baber/{size}/173331_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":10484,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/mk4i-problem/502243/6","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3633487,"name":"FrankJ","username":"FrankJ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/frankj/{size}/5392_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-22T18:48:26.563Z","cooked":"

Even with loctite, you need to properly torque the bolt…

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2025-05-22T18:48:26.563Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":382,"readers_count":381,"score":181.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":502243,"topic_slug":"mk4i-problem","display_username":"FrankJ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15944,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2974 Robot Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/mk4i-problem/502243/7","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3633489,"name":"Mert Ata BABER","username":"BABER","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/baber/{size}/173331_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-22T18:48:32.758Z","cooked":"
Josh_Murphy:

loctite 243

cmwilson13:

Make sure your using 243 not 242 (243 is tolerant of oil 242 is not) and use primer if you still have issues

electroken:

Loctite 243

We used 243 but, maybe the one we bought was bad or fake? I’m not sure if it can go bad while sitting on the shelf, but we’ll get a new one and test with that.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2025-05-22T18:48:51.674Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":3,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":381,"readers_count":380,"score":96.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":502243,"topic_slug":"mk4i-problem","display_username":"Mert Ata BABER","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52778,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/mk4i-problem/502243/8","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3633501,"name":"","username":"cmwilson13","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cmwilson13/{size}/3628_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-22T18:50:04.642Z","cooked":"

shake it vigorously. it definitely settles out and that very negatively affects performance

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2025-05-22T18:50:04.642Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":360,"readers_count":359,"score":147.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":502243,"topic_slug":"mk4i-problem","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":52778,"username":"BABER","name":"Mert Ata BABER","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/baber/{size}/173331_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":10484,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/mk4i-problem/502243/9","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3633523,"name":"FrankJ","username":"FrankJ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/frankj/{size}/5392_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-22T18:54:32.202Z","cooked":"

Officially it has a 1 year shelf life after it is opened. But it seems to last way longer. Even with 243, the threads should be squeaky clean. Also make sure the shaft is seated in its spigot on the pulley.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2025-05-22T18:54:32.202Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":351,"readers_count":350,"score":85.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":502243,"topic_slug":"mk4i-problem","display_username":"FrankJ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15944,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2974 Robot Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/mk4i-problem/502243/10","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3633527,"name":"Rod","username":"Weldingrod1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-22T18:55:22.310Z","cooked":"

Yes, loctite has shelf life. Its pretty long, but “years” is enough for it not to set at all.

Most loctite products don’t set right on inactive metals (without a primer). Inactives are stainless steel, titanium, aluminum, and plastic. If one side is carbon steel or galvanized you are safe This is a recurring issue on our shock an vibe tests; all new engineers seem to find this out the hard way. “I loctited everything, but it just fell off!” The correct reply is “did you prime those stainless steel fasteners?” followed by an introduction to loctite primer…

BTW, on normal metals the primer will make the loctite set MUCH faster. The usual type is copper sulphate, IIRC.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2025-05-22T18:55:22.310Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":347,"readers_count":346,"score":164.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":502243,"topic_slug":"mk4i-problem","display_username":"Rod","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46443,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/mk4i-problem/502243/11","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3633657,"name":"","username":"Thor5090","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thor5090/{size}/226064_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-22T21:03:08.804Z","cooked":"

Vibra-TITE blue works better than any other blue theead locker I’ve used in the past 30 years. You do need to make sure the bolt is clean and dry, ie. no shipping oil residue on the bolt.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2025-05-22T21:03:08.804Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":293,"readers_count":292,"score":118.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":502243,"topic_slug":"mk4i-problem","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":52778,"username":"BABER","name":"Mert Ata BABER","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/baber/{size}/173331_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53198,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"My views are mine and mine alone"},"post_url":"/t/mk4i-problem/502243/12","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3634054,"name":"Liam Singleton","username":"LiamSingleton852","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/liamsingleton852/{size}/219015_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-23T04:28:35.287Z","cooked":"

Happens to us constantly. Black loctite. And superglue.

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2025-05-23T04:28:35.287Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":217,"readers_count":216,"score":73.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":502243,"topic_slug":"mk4i-problem","display_username":"Liam Singleton","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64952,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Drive faster"},"post_url":"/t/mk4i-problem/502243/13","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3634070,"name":"AllenGregoryIV","username":"AllenGregoryIV","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/allengregoryiv/{size}/65531_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-23T05:40:12.488Z","cooked":"

We switched all the 1/4-20 bolts and the shaft shoulder bolts to a small amount red loctite and use a heat gun to loosen them each time we need to.

This is was the best way we found to limit the required maintenance on our modules.

","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2025-05-23T05:40:12.488Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":202,"readers_count":201,"score":85.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":502243,"topic_slug":"mk4i-problem","display_username":"AllenGregoryIV","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":10647,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Engineering Coach - Spectrum 3847/Photon 8515"},"post_url":"/t/mk4i-problem/502243/14","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3634071,"name":"Troy Dietz","username":"troy_dietz","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/troy_dietz/{size}/135768_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-23T05:48:15.104Z","cooked":"

One of our engineers discovered the hard way that loctite is thread lubricant before it sets, as they were frantically trying to get some more tests in before our time slot at the vibe facility ended.

","post_number":15,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2025-05-23T05:48:15.104Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":203,"readers_count":202,"score":55.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":502243,"topic_slug":"mk4i-problem","display_username":"Troy Dietz","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":46443,"username":"Weldingrod1","name":"Rod","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26760,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"❤️ conflict-free COTS"},"post_url":"/t/mk4i-problem/502243/15","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3634081,"name":"Patrick Woolfenden","username":"PatrickW","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/patrickw/{size}/129934_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-23T06:31:24.682Z","cooked":"

While I do believe when properly tightened with threadlocker this screw will stay tight, it does require disassembly to check if it has loosened.

This is one of a couple reasons we choose to combine the center column with the turret gear on the MK5 module. No need to worry about this screw coming loose if it doesn’t exist in the new design.

","post_number":16,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2025-05-23T06:32:41.931Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":195,"readers_count":194,"score":219.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":502243,"topic_slug":"mk4i-problem","display_username":"Patrick Woolfenden","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":10}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":30603,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2910 | swervedrive.com"},"post_url":"/t/mk4i-problem/502243/16","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":10},{"id":"laughing","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":11,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3634205,"name":"Mike Marandola","username":"Mike_Marandola","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mike_marandola/{size}/255213_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-23T13:20:34.190Z","cooked":"

It 2024 we had screws loosening out of our modules constantly. We even came back from a match with a drive Kraken totally off sitting in our bellypan. We found out it was due to students not torqueing the fasteners nearly enough and most likely not using enough Loctite.

This year, we used a torque wrench on every single fastener and had zero issues the entire season. I think we were going to ~20 in-lb for 10-32 and ~45 in-lb for 1/4-20.
